title: Firefox automatic startup on system boot
content: I run Linux Debian 12 (bookworm), and there seems to be no way to disable Firefox from automatically starting up after system boot. I've searched through settings, read countless articles on the internet, looked at system auto-startup applications, but wasn't able to find anything that worked. I even looked in about:config, but couldn't find anything. Firefox isn't automatically started by my system and there is no parameter that disables it. I also didn't click through any choices about autostart when I first opened Firefox.

title: Not receiving 6-digit code for login verification
content:
Hello,

I'd like to login into my account on a new laptop, so I can sync my passwords and bookmarks with this new device. When I try to log in on this laptop and enter my password, Firefox then prompts me to enter a 6-digit code sent via e-mail to verify the login. I've tried this numerous times but I never seem to receive this e-mail. I've tried requesting this code across multiple days and at different times of the day, but nothing helps. I've also added accounts@firefox.com to my contacts and checked the spam folder. I presume there is something wrong with my account, since my e-mailaccount receives e-mails from others just fine. Can someone help me with this issue?

Thanks.

title: Arama sonuçlarında alışveriş öneri görsellerinin görünmemesi.
content:
Merhabalar,

Bir süredir arama motorunda alıveriş sonuçları sıralandığında; bu sonuçalara ait çerçeveler içerisinde ürün görselleri görünmemekte, sadece başlıkları ve fiyat bilgileri gelmekte. Bu sebeple aradaığım ürünü bulmak için her sonucu tek tek açıp göreselini görmem gerekmekte ve bu bana çok zaman kaybettirmektedir. Bu sorunun çözümü varsa yardım etmenizi rica ediyorum.

İyi çalışmalar.
creator: seziver

title: my tiktok isn't working
content: TikTok might not be working due to a few common reasons like a poor internet connection, server problems on TikTok’s side, an outdated app version, or too much cached data. Sometimes, the app might crash or fail to load videos properly. Restarting the app, clearing cache, or updating it usually helps fix the problem. bold text

title: Game site not fully loading on Firefox (assets fail or go missing)
content:
Hi Firefox community,

I’m currently testing a simple HTML-based site hosted on epizy.com, where I provide information and visuals related to a game mod (NullsBrawll). While everything works fine in Chrome and Edge, Firefox often fails to load key assets — especially images and script files that showcase the game’s content or guide users through the APK installation process.

Some problems I’m running into:

Game-related images (e.g., character banners, gameplay screenshots) fail to load intermittently JS-based animations or carousel sliders showing features don’t always run This issue happens more often on mobile Firefox Other browsers show the same files fine, even on slower networks

I’m wondering if:

Firefox handles free-hosted static files differently than other browsers? There are known issues with HTTP resources from epizy.com on Firefox? Any specific headers, caching rules, or SSL setup I should be aware of?

Thanks in advance for any help! Just trying to make the Game experience smooth for all browsers.
creator: ayeshafazalkarim29

title: Mozilla Firefox/Waterfox bookmark folders bug
content:
Hi! I need some troubleshooting help. Idk what happened, but I think it was a syncing issue in between the two browsers. I just plan on using just Firefox to hopefully prevent this bug in the future.

I originally have bookmark folders on my toolbar, but when I checked, the old folders were gone. Though everything in them was still in my toolbar, so it's a reaaally long "Show more bookmarks" drop down list. But when I check "Manage Bookmarks", the folders are still there. I tried exporting and re-importing the bookmarks but it didn't work. Here are some screenshots attached. Help?

Edit: After checking, it turns out my "manage bookmars" and toolbar are the same. My folders and bookmarks are there, but for some reason the contents are outside the folders. Is there a fix for this and how to prevent it?
